articles.title: Many of the Best Wall Street Jobs for Women Aren’t on Wall Street
articles.description: Women who want to manage money seem to be having better luck doing it someplace other than Wall Street.

articles.title: This £47.90 burger is served in a bun of lobster tails and is stuffed full of bacon and cheese
articles.description: The burger is inspired by KFC's Double Down burger, which swaps the bun for two pieces of fried chicken.

articles.author: Danny Chambers
articles.title: Gluten-free dogs? Pets deserve better than this evidence-free fad
articles.description: Animal owners are increasingly falling for potentially risky fad pet diets or homeopathic alternatives to vaccines, warn vets Danny Chambers and Zoe Belshaw

articles.title: Fortnite is coming to Android, but players risk downloading malware
articles.description: When blockbuster game Fortnite hits Android phones, gamers will be able to get it outside Google Play, which could leave them vulnerable to scams

articles.author: Nick Wadhams, Justin Sink
articles.title: Trump Stays Publicly Quiet While Saudi Arabia-Canada Tensions Rise
articles.description: The Trump administration is privately trying to coax Saudi Arabia to dial back hostilities with Canada even as the U.S. maintains a hands-off public approach to the escalating dispute between the two key allies, a senior U.S. official said.

articles.author: Danielle Bochove
articles.title: Barrick Says China Partner for Copper ‘Makes All Kinds of Sense’
articles.description: Barrick Gold Corp. Executive Chairman John Thornton says the Canadian miner is looking at its copper assets “very seriously” to see if it makes sense to form a copper company with one or two partners, most likely from China.

articles.author: Shirin Ghaffary
articles.title: WeWork is still growing phenomenally — and losing a lot of money
articles.description: WeWork generated $422 million in the second quarter, representing 113 percent year-over-year growth. That’s faster growth than in prior quarters. Based on June’s revenue, it’s now on a $1.8 billion annual run rate.

articles.title: The New York Times’ ‘Trump bump’ in digital subscription growth is over
articles.description: Almost 40 percent of new digital subscriptions are for crosswords and cooking.
